properties.name: Aston's Eyot
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 One of the finest eyots in the land. Sloe repository. If challenged by an undergraduate of Christ Church College (semper etc.), compulsory shoe-polishing may be in order.

properties.name: Folly bridge
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 Stone bridge with island covered in religious icons to the east, and an expensive pub to the west. Departure point for the Thames batouche.

properties.name: Grandpont nature park
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 Home to the old gasworks, with a fine bridge leading thereto, and an odd sculpture of a big hand. Ate a rollmop on a bench here a while back. Cracking.

properties.name: Hinksey reservoir
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 The seagulls get a bit aggressive when one tries to feed the ducks, coots and geese. Nature\'s laws in action.

properties.name: Iffley Lock
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 A nice lock, with a mathematical wooden bridge, and an ASBO notice.

properties.name: John Ruskin's abortive road
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316Ruskin, aided by undergraduates including Oscar Wilde and Arnold Toynbee, attempted to build a helpful road, linking North and South Hinksey. But once he wandered off to write \'The Stones of Venice\', his bone-idle charges gave up.

properties.name: Lawrence of Arabia's underground swim
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 An underground tributary of the Thames, swum by T.E. Lawrence in the name of bravado.

properties.name: Marlborough Road meadow
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316Behind the desirable properties of (western) Marlborough Road. Currently flooded, as in the photo.

properties.name: May Morning berk-magnet
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 An alternate site for perilous May-morning river jumping hearties, if the authorities have blockaded Magdelene Bridge.

properties.name: Mesopotamia
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316  Where civilisation began. Only in Oxford, between Marston and the Parks.

properties.name: More river bit
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 This is a more river bit, between one bit and another bit, but very pretty nonetheless, especially with the light and that. April trod in the river.

properties.name: Muddy place
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 I don\'t know where it was, but I think it was here. Duck-on-duck violence witnessed. Exactly what the white man wants.

properties.name: Mumbo jumbo junkie retreat
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 Used to belong to Harcourt, Gladstone\'s Home Secretary. Now a venue for eastern philosophy to be done on celebrities who are full of drugs.

properties.name: Old Jericho boatyard
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316Fight the power, barge-folk. Developers are turning this into a \'Venetian-style piazza\'. Thom Yorke and Philip Pullman don\'t like it. Nor should you.

properties.name: Osney Lock
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 A fearsome lock, overlooked by a desirable houses.

properties.name: Soggy patch
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 Nature at its moistest. Out of bounds for the ASBO kids, according to the notice at Iffley Lock. But too damp for anything to be flammable. I\'m stumped.

properties.name: Spare Weir
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316It describes itself

properties.name: St. Sepulchre's graveyard
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 Beautiful secluded graveyard, separated from the Oxford canal by a building for the yuppies.

properties.name: Trove
properties.description: Posted by Misterpete316 This is where we found five English pounds. Keep an eye out, if you\'re passing.
